name: Neurodevelopmental Disorders and Diseases
description: Proper development of the human brain is essential for human health.  This course will examine how neurodevelopment failures contribute to neurological disorders and diseases, including epilepsy and autism.  Current research from basic, translational, and clinical perspectives will be examined using case studies.  The impact of neurodevelopmental disorders and diseases on the individual and community will be discussed.
prerequisites: 14 FCE complete, HMB300H1/HMB310H1/ HMB320H1/ CJH332H1 (formerly CSB332H1)
